item.title: Aung San Suu Kyi Seeks Meeting With Myanmar’s Military
item.description: The democracy leader asked to talk to the commander on the basis of “national reconciliation” after her party’s apparent landslide victory.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS FULLER
item.media:description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the leader of Myanmar’s democracy movement, delivering a speech in the city of Yangon this week.

item.title: World Briefing: Canada: Montreal to Dump Sewage Into River During Repair Work
item.description: The mayor said the city would dump about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into the St. Lawrence River.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN

item.title: World Briefing: Chile: Powerful Quake in Pacific
item.description: The authorities said there were no reports of injuries or serious damage from the quake, which the United States Geological Survey said had a preliminary magnitude of 6.9.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: René Girard, French Theorist of the Social Sciences, Dies at 91
item.description: Professor Girard’s explorations of literature and myth helped establish influential ideas about how people are motivated to want things.
item.dc:creator: QUENTIN HARDY

item.title: Rampage by a Soldier Known for Loyalty Shakes Jordan, and a Family
item.description: Anwar Saad was a fierce nationalist and a deeply conservative Muslim. So his relatives were flummoxed at the notion that he could have killed five at a police training center before being fatally shot.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID

item.title: Support for Israel Must Be Bipartisan, Netanyahu Tells U.S. Audience
item.description: The Israeli prime minister, speaking in Washington, appealed to Democrats still troubled by the public feud over the Iran nuclear deal.
item.category: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: Egyptian Resort, Bruised by Sinai Jet Crash, Is Accustomed to Shocks
item.description: Ten days after the crash of the plane from Sharm el Sheikh killed 224 people, many business owners there were steeling themselves for short-term losses but shrugging off predictions of the beach resort’s demise.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: Hotel pools like this one in Sharm el Sheikh are largely empty after the crash of a Russian plane prompted many countries to suspend flights to the resort.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Escaping Reality With Brazil’s Globo TV
item.description: A media giant enthralls a country’s TV-addicted viewers with empty soap operas and inane commentary on the news.
item.dc:creator: VANESSA BARBARA

item.title: Violent Loop Engulfs Youths in Jerusalem
item.description: Two Palestinian cousins accused of a stabbing were apparently inspired by a video showing harsh Israeli treatment of a suspect accused of an earlier stabbing.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER and RAMI NAZZAL
item.media:description: Israeli police officers on Tuesday led away a Palestinian boy accused of stabbing an Israeli security guard.

item.title: Russian Artist Sets Security Service’s Door on Fire
item.description: In his latest act of protest, Pyotr Pavlensky set fire to the entrance of Russia’s Federal Security Service and was charged with vandalism.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Ex-British Soldier, 66, Is Arrested in Bloody Sunday Massacre
item.description: The suspect, whom the authorities did not identify, was questioned about the 1972 killings of unarmed civilian marchers by British soldiers in Northern Ireland.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN and DOUGLAS DALBY
item.media:description: Protesters in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, carried pictures in January 1973 of civilians who were killed a year earlier in the "Bloody Sunday" massacre.

item.title: Economic Scene: India Is Caught in a Climate Change Quandary
item.description: An impoverished nation must balance domestic demands for development and international demands to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
item.dc:creator: EDUARDO PORTER
item.media:description: Waves from the Arabian Sea crash over a sea wall in Mumbai. Some 150 million people in India are at risk from storm surges associated with rising sea levels.

item.title: David Cameron Outlines Demands for Britain to Stay in E.U.
item.description: The British prime minister is seeking economic safeguards, a stronger role for national parliaments and the restriction of welfare entitlements for some migrants.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE and STEVEN ERLANGER

item.title: Korean War Memorial Group Finds More Aid in Korea Than in U.S.
item.description: The foundation does not have the money it needs to maintain the memorial on the National Mall, and what it does have came from South Korean corporations.
item.dc:creator: JADA F. SMITH
item.media:description: The Korean War Veterans Memorial Foundation is struggling to set up a maintenance fund for the memorial in Washington.

item.title: World Briefing: 2 Accused of Being Russian Soldiers Appear in Court in Ukraine
item.description: The men, who confessed to being members of Russia’s military while recovering from wounds in captivity, told a Ukrainian court that they were unemployed, not soldiers.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Policiais no Rio Não São Indiciados na Morte de Menino de 10 anos
item.description: Uma investigação concluiu que os policiais envolvidos neste tiroteio fatal, que causou protestos nas favelas do Rio, agiram em legítima defesa.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO

item.title: No Charges Against Rio Police in Fatal Shooting of 10-Year-Old Boy
item.description: An inquiry said the officers involved in the fatal shooting, which prompted a public outcry in Rio’s violence-plagued favelas, were acting in self-defense.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO

item.title: Romania’s President Picks Dacian Ciolos as New Prime Minister
item.description: Mr. Ciolos, an expert on agriculture, is considered to be a capable manager whose appointment could help calm the political unrest that has roiled the country.
item.dc:creator: KIT GILLET

item.title: Montreal to Dump Raw Sewage as It Makes Repairs
item.description: The controversial sewage diversion may last as long as seven days. The mayor said the city had no choice.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Portugal’s Government Ousted in Challenge to Austerity
item.description: The prime minister, Pedro Passos Coelho, had been held up as a model proponent of the belt-tightening prescriptions pushed by European Union officials.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
